My Girl and its sequel are both splendid films about adolescence.

But the problem with this release is that both films are basically the original discs re-packaged.
Aspect Ratio: 1.33:1 (both films were shot in 1.78:1 and matted to 1.85:1 for theaters)
The artwork on the discs was disappointing, only a pink disc for the second film and the original film's disc uses a blue silhouette of Chlumsky and Culkin preparing to kiss.

Take my advice, buy the brand new Double Feature disc for $5, it has the original film in Widescreen, and unfortunately the sequel is a port over of the original 2002 DVD.

I was only able to give the movies a 5 stars, but if I could give it a 10 I would. I always loved watching My Girl & My Girl 2 when I was younger. I am glad I was able to purchase them on dvd for my daughter so that she may enjoy the same experience. I recommend the movies to girls between the ages of 7 - 17 and older. I still cry when Thomas J dies on My Girl it is a very emotional, comical, and family/friend-oriented movie so is My Girl 2.
Great classic movie -- and a great box set deal!  Pick it up for your collections, you won't be sorry!

How can you not fall in love with this story of childhood and coming of age?  How can you not like names like "Veda Sultanfuss" and "Thomas J"?  How can you not like such sure knowledge about getting married as: "When you get old, you just have to"? and lines like, "Veda, if you don't marry Mr. Bixler, would you think of me?"

My Girl gives a gentle and not-too-sweet message about not only the loss of innocence but of friends as well.  It is not heavy-handed in any way.  It appeals to the viewer's heart without trying to force the issue and makes you laugh along the way, too.  There is simple good humor here and a good ending.

My Girl 2 takes up where the first movie leaves off, though it is a little hard to recapture the spirit of the original.  This is still a very watchable and enjoyable movie, with some of the original humor and tenderness exhibited, as Veda searches for and finds someone who knew her deceased mother, whom she never knew, and her first teenaged love.

Get this pair of movies, at a price you can't beat, and cry, laugh, and have fun!

This is a great set of movies. The friendship of Veda and Thomas J.is the storyline behind  my girl 1 She is the daughter of Dan Akroyd who plays a funeral director. Jamie Lee Curtis comes into the picture as a makeup artist. They soon become a couple.
Veda and Thomas J are best friends. Spend alot of time together. One day he is stung by many many bees and tragically does not survive. Veda is lost without her best friend.
She also has a crush of her teacher and deides to take an adult writing class, The other classmates sometimes make fun of the 11 year old who write her own style of poetry. During the movie Veda also thinks she is "dying" and visits the doctor all the time. She also becomes a "WOMAN: during the movies getting her first period. The little girl is growing up.

My Girl 2 is minus Thomas J. but all the others are in the new movie. Veda decides to go and find about her mom, doing all the research and traveling She is successful in  her journey.
Back at home dan and jamie Lee are expecting their first child together.

You really have to see the 2 movies in order to enjoy both.

Both these movies are great. The first is my favorite, but the second is a nice bonus. Although a small cast, I think all roles were played by the same actors. It's cool to see how the actors have changed between the first and second films.
